awd_titl_txt: RIA: Synthesis of Reliable and Low-Power VLSI               Circuits
awd_abstract_narration: Najm         This research is on synthesis algorithms for design of  reliable, low power CMOS and BiCMOS VLSI designs.  The basis for  the research is to use boolean transition density to measure  deviant activity and thus to help solve power consumption and  reliability issues.  Research activities include:  1. exploring use of circuit activity as a parameter to be  minimized; and  2. investigating the effects of minimizing local power  dissipation on circuit design.  Algorithms incorporating these new optimization ideas are being  developed and integrated into a synthesis environment.  The  environment integrates the objectives of optimizing area,  performance, testability, reliability, and power into a unified  set of design algorithms.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division of Computing and Communication Foundations

pgm_ele.pgm_ele_name: DES AUTO FOR MICRO & NANO SYS
